intro: Catabrosa vilfoidea, commonly known as the silky catabrosa, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Catabrosa vilfoidea is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
